results.title: Reedy river
results.creator_credit: ABC, Keith Gow, Peter Hamilton and Peter Hamilton Productions
results.brief_description: Lawson’s poem is dramatised and set to music in a pastoral setting. Describes the hardships and joys of settling in virgin country, and for the settler, the greatest hardship of all, the loss of his beautiful wife. Uses flashback technique. Enacted by Jock Levy and Sylvia Salisbury while the words are sung by Alex Hood, Barbara Lysiak and the Ramblers.

results.title: Redfern Beach (D)
results.creator_credit: Catriona McKenzie, Yvonne Maden, Rachel Roberts and AFTRS
results.brief_description: An islander Max (Michael Huahihe) finds himself working at a fish processing plant and struggles to be accepted. Unsure of the violent lifestyle, he attempts to move on once given perspective when befriended by Harry (Tony Barry), a local fisherman and his new lover, Phaedra.

results.title: Red Sunday: the story of the Battle of Little Big Horn
results.creator_credit: James B. Kelly, James R. Graff, Robert A. Henkel and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: A study of the Battle of Little Big Horn which weaves a wealth of original drawings (mostly done by Indian who were participants of the actual battle), photographs and paintings, both by Indian and white artists with recreated live cavalry action on the site itself. Narrated by John McIntire. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Red sands, blue seas
results.creator_credit: Oren Siedler, Sally Regan, CAAMA, Australian Film Commission and Discovery Video
results.brief_description: A fascinating 1/2 hour documentary about a group of aboriginal women potters from the deserts of central Australia making their first ever trip away from their homeland. They travel to a tropical Indonesian island to visit a group of women potters there. The experience of seeing the ocean and tropical bush for the first time and the clash of cultures.

results.title: Red river
results.brief_description: Director Howard Hawks’ classic western stars the legendary John Wayne at the peak of his career and Montgomery Clift in his screen debut. Walter Brennan heads the outstanding supporting cast. The film is an account of the first cattle drive over the Chisholm Trail, from deep Texas to Abilene, Kansas. Authentic detail and stunning cinematography bring to life the trials and tribulations of this extraordinary challenge for the men who battled the dust, rain, heat and frustration of the long, hard drive. The demands of this rigorous journey further strain the edgy relationship between the film’s key characters. Tom Dunson (Wayne) is a self-made cattle king whose single-mindedness has turned him into a cold-blooded executioner, ruthlessly determined to take the cattle to Abilene his way. Arguably the best western ever made, “Red River” captures both the grandeur of the early West and the sheer determination of its people.

results.title: Red light in full flight
results.creator_credit: Samia Mikhail, Sharyn Prentice and Flamingo Star Films
results.brief_description: The culture of Middle eastern belly dancing in Australia is a prolific one, with belly dancers in Australia outnumbering dancers in other countries. The director gleans anecdotes about the history of this sensual womens’ dance and interviews Australian dancers about their dance, their lives and their culture. It also discusses the importance of traditional cultural dance in women’s lives.

results.title: Red heat (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Walter Hill, Gordon Carroll and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Russia’s deadliest drug smuggler has gone to Chicago to gain dominance of the drug market in the United States. Moscow’s most disciplined police officer is sent over to hunt him down, working in collaboration with a wise-cracking U.S. detective who follows his own rules. Starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and James Belushi, “Red Heat” is a well-crafted mix of humour and action with some deftly executed stunt sequences.

results.title: Red ensign
results.creator_credit: Michael Powell, Jerome Jackson and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: This is the story of David Barr, a shipbuilder, who fights to keep the shipyards open during the Depression of the 1930’s. David Barr fights the cautious businessman, Lord Dean, both for the affection of the heiress, June MacKinnon, and for the use of her money to finance his construction program. Stars Leslie Banks, Carol Goodner, Alfred Drayton, Frank Vosper.

results.title: For gentlemen only
results.creator_credit: Michael Scott, Vladmir Valenta, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of two retired old men whose comfortable world is threatened when their hotel, formerly for gentlemen only, decides to admit women. The film shows how they react to and cope with this change. (Award: Toronto)

results.title: Red Beard = Akahige
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: The last collaboration between actor Toshiro Mifune and Kurosawa, is a moral tale about a young and arrogant medical graduate - charged by his modern training and ambition - who is devastated to be assigned to an impoverished local clinic. The young doctor’s mentor, Red Beard, aims to show the young gun that there is more to life than prestige and power and more to healing than medicine. Set in 1820, this is a poignant and compassionate work; a humanistic narrative that follows the character’s arc from supercilious to empathetic whilst presenting a myriad of stories about the villagers and their struggles.
